predicate.note: Frames file for 'culture' based on sentences in ECTB 2. No Verbnet entry. Comparison with 'nurture'.

roleset.name: grow, cultivate, groom or nurture for one's own purposes

example.name: active
example.text: She spent a great deal of time culturing new contacts on Capitol Hill.

example.name: adjective
example.text: Their films, however, help serious cinema-goers in Taiwan and around the world to better confront life, and at the same time win international exposure for Taiwan, * enabling [the island's more cultured aspects]-1 [*]-1 to break through in the face of international political taboos and wrangling.
